intro: Leucocoryne coquimbensis, commonly known as the Coquimbo lily, is a flowering plant native to Chile. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking white, bell-shaped flowers. The plant has strap-like, evergreen leaves that are typically blue-green in color. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires moderate to bright light. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
